tit.cmt: Rebellion として統一しました。

The Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro is a domestic conflict which occurred in the Nara period.

sen.j: 恵美押勝の乱ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu.
It is also called the Rebellion of Emi no Oshikatsu.

sen.j: 孝謙天皇・道鏡と対立した太帥（太政大臣）・藤原仲麻呂（恵美押勝）が乱を起こして、滅ぼされた。
sen.e: Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also called EMI no Oshikatsu) conflicted with Emperor Koken and Dokyo, and rebelled against them, but was eventually defeated.
Daijo-daijin (grand minister of state) FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also called EMI no Oshikatsu) conflicted with Empress Koken and Dokyo, rebelled against them, but was eventually defeated.

sen.e: Daijo-daijin (grand minister of state) FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (also called EMI no Oshikatsu) conflicted with Empress Koken and Dokyo, rebelled against them, but was eventually defeated.

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂は光明皇后の信任を得て紫微令に任じられて次第に台頭した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, winning the confidence of Empress Komyo, was appointed to Shibi-rei and gradually gained political power.

sen.j: 孝謙天皇が即位すると仲麻呂は孝謙天皇と光明皇太后の権威を背景に政権を完全に掌握した。
sen.e: After the enthronement of Empress Koken, Nakamaro completely took the reins of government, backed by the authority of Empress Koken and Empress Dowager Komyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 天平宝字2年（758年）、仲麻呂の推す淳仁天皇を即位させて、太保（右大臣）に任ぜられ、恵美押勝の名を与えられる。
sen.e: In 758, Nakamaro was appointed to taiho, or udaijin (Minister of the Right), and also given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu by Emperor Junnin, to whom Nakamaro strongly supported to become Emperor.
In 758, Nakamaro was appointed to Taiho, or Udaijin (minister of the right), and also given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu by Emperor Junnin, to whom Nakamaro strongly supported to become Emperor.
sen.cmt: 役職名を大文字から始めるようにUdaijin として統一しました。
sen.e: In 758, Nakamaro was appointed to Taiho, or Udaijin (minister of the right), and also given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu by Emperor Junnin, to whom Nakamaro strongly supported to become Emperor.

sen.j: 天平宝字4年（760年）には遂に太師（太政大臣）にまで登りつめた。
sen.e: In 760, Nakamaro finally won the position of Taishi, orDaijo-daijin (Grand Minister).
In 760, Nakamaro finally won the position of Taishi, orDaijo-daijin.
sen.cmt: 太政大臣 既出のため補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 栄耀栄華を極めた仲麻呂だが、光明皇太后が死去し、孝謙上皇が弓削道鏡を寵愛しはじめたことで暗転する。
sen.e: Once reaching the prosperity, the fate of Nakamaro turned for the worse after the death of Empress Dowager Komyo and the retired Empress Koken began to make a favorite of YUGE no Dokyo.

sen.j: 仲麻呂は、淳仁天皇を通じて孝謙上皇に道鏡への寵愛を諌めさせたが、これが上皇を激怒させた。
sen.e: Nakamaro, by way of Emperor Junnin, remonstrated retired Empress Koken for her patronage of Dokyo, which angered Koken.
Nakamaro, by way of Emperor Junnin, remonstrated Retired Empress Koken for her patronage of Dokyo, which angered Koken.
Nakamaro, by way of Emperor Junnin, remonstrated Retired Empress Koken for her patronage of Dokyo, which angered Koken.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇は怒りのあまり出家して尼になるとともに「天皇は小事を行い、大事と賞罰は自分が行う」と宣言してしまった。
sen.e: Getting so furious, the retired Empress Koken entered into priesthood and declared that emperor should conduct minor matters while she should determine important decisions and be in charge of reward and punishment.

Getting so furious, the Retired Empress Koken entered into priesthood and declared that emperor should conduct minor matters while she should determine important decisions and be in charge of reward and punishment.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇の道鏡への寵愛は深まり、逆に仲麻呂を激しく憎むようになった。
sen.e: The retired Empress Koken gave even deeper love for Dokyo, while she furiously hated Nakamaro.
The Retired Empress Koken gave even deeper love for Dokyo, while she furiously hated Nakamaro.

sen.j: 焦った仲麻呂は軍権をもって孝謙上皇と道鏡に対抗しようとし、天平宝字8年（764年）9月、淳仁天皇に願って都督四畿内三関近江丹波播磨等国兵事使に任じられた。
sen.e: Being fretted by the situation, Nakamaro decided to confront the retired Empress Koken and Dokyo by resorting to military power, and in September 764, he was appointed by Emperor Junnin to Totoku governor general of Shikinai (four provinces close to the Capital) sangen (three major barrier stations) Omi Tanba Harima Kokuheijishi.

Being fretted by the situation, Nakamaro decided to confront the Retired Empress Koken and Dokyo by resorting to military power, and in October 764, he was appointed by Emperor Junnin to Totoku governor general of Shikinai (four provinces close to the Capital) and sangen (three major barrier stations) as well as military chief of Omi, Tanba and Harima provinces.
sen.cmt: 都督四畿内三関近江丹波播磨等国兵事使→Totoku governor general of Shikinai (four provinces close to the Capital) and sangen (three major barrier stations) as well as military chief of Omi, Tanba and Harima provinces としました（定訳不明です）。グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 諸国の兵20人を都に集めて訓練する規定になっていたが、仲麻呂は600人の兵を動員するよう大外記高丘比良麻呂に命じた。
sen.e: The position was prescribed to gather 20 soldiers from various districts to the capital for training, but Nakamaro ordered daigeki (senior secretary) TAKAOKA no Hiramaro to mobilize 600.

sen.j: 仲麻呂は都に兵力を集めて反乱を起こそうと企んでいた。
sen.e: Nakamaro intended to gather troops in the capital and to rebel.

sen.j: 9月11日 (旧暦)（10月14日）、比良麻呂は孝謙上皇に動員令を密告。
sen.e: On September 11 (by old calendar), Hiramaro reported to the retired Empress Koken about the mobilization order of Nakamaro.
On October 14, Hiramaro reported to the Retired Empress Koken about the mobilization order of Nakamaro.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇は少納言山村王を淳仁天皇の居る中宮院に派遣して、皇権の発動に必要な玉璽と駅鈴を回収させた。
sen.e: The retired Empress Koken dispatched shonagon (minor councilor of state) Yamamura-O to Chuguin Palace, the residence of Emperor Junnin, and recovered Imperial Seal and ekirei (a bell), both needed for the exercise of imperial power.

sen.j: これを知った仲麻呂は子の藤原訓儒麻呂に山村王の帰路を襲撃させて、玉璽と駅鈴の奪回を図った。

sen.e: However, shojo (junior lieutenant) SAKANOUE no Karitamaro, who was imperial guard Ryoge no kan, and shoso OSHIKA no Shimatari both were sent and shooted Kusumaro to death.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇は仲麻呂の邸に勅使紀船守を送り、官位の剥奪と藤原姓の剥奪を通告した。
sen.e: The retired Empress Koken sent imperial messenger KI no Funamori to the residence of Nakamaro and informed that he should be divested official court rank as well as Fujiwara cognomen.

sen.j: その夜、仲麻呂は一族を率いて平城京を脱出、宇治市へ入り、仲麻呂が長年国司をつとめ勢力地盤だった近江国の国府を目指した。
sen.e: On the night, Nakamaro led his family and escaed from Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and entered Uji City, heading for provincial capital of the Province of Omi where he had been kokushi (provincial governor) for many years.

On the night, Nakamaro led his family and escaped from Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and entered Uji City, heading for provincial capital of the Province of Omi where he had been kokushi (provincial governor) for many years.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇は吉備真備を召して従三位に叙し仲麻呂誅伐を命じる。
sen.e: The retired Empress Koken recalled KIBI no Makibi, gave junior third rank, and ordered to kill Nakamaro.
The Retired Empress Koken recalled KIBI no Makibi, gave the official rank of Jusanmi (junior third rank), and ordered to kill Nakamaro.

sen.j: 仲麻呂の行動を予測した真備は、山城国日下部子麻呂と衛門少尉佐伯伊多智の率いる官軍を先回りさせて勢多橋を焼いて、東山道への進路を塞いだ。
sen.e: Makibi speculated Nakamaro's action, and sent a government army led by KUSAKABE no Komaro from the Province of Yamashiro and Emon shojo (junior lieutenant) SAEKI no Itaji and had them burn theSetabashi Bridge, effectively blocking the route toTosan-do Road.

sen.j: 仲麻呂はやむなく子の藤原辛加知が国司になっている越前国に入り再起を図ろうとし、琵琶湖の湖西を越前に向い北進する。
sen.e: Nakamaro was forced to head north along the west coast of Lake Biwa for the Province of Echizen, where his son FUJIWARA no Shikachi was governor, and prepare for a comeback.
Nakamaro was forced to head north along the west coast of Lake Biwa for the Echizen Province, where his son FUJIWARA no Shikachi was kokushi, and prepared for a comeback.
sen.cmt: Echizen Province としました。Prepared としました。
sen.e: Nakamaro was forced to head north along the west coast of Lake Biwa for the Echizen Province, where his son FUJIWARA no Shikachi was kokushi, and prepared for a comeback.

sen.j: 淳仁天皇を連れ出せなかった仲麻呂は、塩焼王（かつての塩焼王）を偽帝に擁立し、太政官符をもって諸国に号令した。
sen.e: Having failed to take Emperor Junnin with him, Nakamaro raised Prince Shioyaki as fake emperor, and sent orders to local governments with daijokanpu (the official documents of the Daijokan).

sen.j: ここに、二つの朝廷ができたことになる。
sen.e: Thus, there rose two Imperial Courts at that time.
Thus, there rose two Imperial Courts at that time.

sen.j: 官軍の佐伯伊多智は越前に馳せ急ぎ、まだ事変を知らぬ辛加知を斬り、物部広成に愛発関（近江と越前の国境の関所）を固めさせた。
sen.e: SAEKI no Itaji of the Imperial army rushed to the Province of Echizen and killed Shikaji who did not know about the rebellion, and made MONONOBE no Hironari to close Arachi no-seki checking station, which was located at the border of Provinces of.

sen.j: 仲麻呂軍の先発隊精兵数十人が愛発関で敗れた。
sen.e: Nakamaro's advance party of some tens of soldiers were defeated at Arachi no-seki checking station.

sen.j: 辛加知の死を知らない仲麻呂は愛発関を避け、舟で琵琶湖東岸に渡り越前に入ろうとするが、逆風で舟が難破しそうになり断念して、塩津に上陸し陸路、愛発関の突破をはかった。
sen.e: Without knowing the death of Shikaji, Nakamaro tried to avoid Arachi no-seki checking station, and cross the lake by boat to the east coast, which failed eventually due to the against wind, and proceeded land route from Shiozu to go through Arachi no-seki.

Without knowing the death of Shikaji, Nakamaro tried to avoid Arachi no-seki checking station and cross the Lake Biwa by boat to the east coast, but failed eventually due to the against wind, and proceeded land route from Shiozu to go through Arachi no-seki.

sen.j: 佐伯伊多智が防戦して、仲麻呂軍を撃退する。
sen.e: SAEKI no Itaji defended the Arachi no-seki, and defeated the army of Nakamaro.

sen.j: 仲麻呂軍は退却して三尾（近江国高島郡）の古城に篭った。

Nakamaro's army retreated to an old castle in Sanbi of Takashima County, Omi Province.
